description: Strengthening the Capacity of the National Human Rights Commission (SC-NHRC)

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description:
Strengthening the Capacity of National Human Rights Commission continues to focus on  to strengthen the capacity of NHRC in the areas of:
i)preparation of human rights audit plan and review of human rights compliance in legislation, policies, plans, practices and procedures for ensuring respect and fulfillment of human rights by the state actors,
ii) monitoring the implementation of international human rights instruments and UPR recommendations to fulfill state obligations, 
iii)supporting for HR friendly New Constitution and dissemination of human rights provisions of new constitution
iv)protection and promotion of civil, political and socio-economic rights through investigation, monitoring and advocacy, 
v)supporting for policy formulation, staff development, and collaboration with civil society and Human Rights NGOs, and
vi) review of existing laws in line with international human rights treaties and constitution.
subproject.title: Strengthening Capacity-NHRC

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to prevent, reduce and mitigate the impact of conflict
subproject.description:

subproject.title: Strengthening Capacity-NHRC

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description:
1) NHRC capacity strengthened in promoting and monitoring, investigation, documentation and reporting of human rights violations.
2) Selected laws reviewed and amendments recommended in order to comply with international treaties as a part of fulfilling treaty obligations.
subproject.title: Selected Laws Reviews & recomm
